dcterms:description: The CCD V2 dataset is open-source and represents the speech of 5,567 unique speakers from various regions, including India, the USA, Indonesia, Vietnam, Brazil, Mexico, and the Philippines. It includes seven self-labeled attributes such as age, gender, languages, disabilities, physical characteristics, and geographic location, with a total of 26,467 video recordings.
dcterms:title: Casual Conversation Dataset version 2 (CCD V2)

dcterms:description: The FLEURS dataset is designed for few-shot learning evaluation of universal representations of speech, focusing on multilingual capabilities.
dcterms:title: FLEURS dataset

dcterms:description: The MMS-lab dataset is a labeled dataset derived from recordings of New Testament readings in 1,130 languages, comprising 49,000 hours of data.
dcterms:title: MMS-lab (Massively Multilingual Speech labeled dataset)

dcterms:description: The MMS-unlab dataset is an unlabeled dataset containing 9,345 hours of audio recordings collected from the Global Recordings Network, organized into 3,860 languages.
dcterms:title: MMS-unlab (Massively Multilingual Speech unlabeled dataset)

dcterms:creator: Josh Meyer

dcterms:description: The Artie Bias Corpus is an open dataset for detecting demographic bias in speech applications, curated as a subset of the Mozilla Common Voice corpus.
dcterms:title: Artie Bias Corpus
